Posted By: Hokeymon (12/18/2009 7:46:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I love how if this monster gets Flanked it will die of effects before the battle even begins. What is it with all these 2/2, 2 manage monsters with horrific negatives? Cleverly getting around a negative effect is a great incentive to use a monster that has one paired with unusually high stats, but how many players out there look and this card and go "Awesome! If I can just prevent my enemy from blocking, I can do some mediocre damage with this!"
